pageContext.description: May have been partly ground recently (at edge) + has been damaged in places by blows. Good condition, but has a casting hole on face. Sharp edge.
pageContext.associations: One of 12 socketed celts + 2 lumps of bronze (originally 16 implements + 2 lumps).
pageContext.publications: Described and figured with complete hoard (as still remaining) in "The Naturalist" p. 236, 1923, by Mr. J. Sheppard.
pageContext.site: Riding,Everthorpe,Gravel Pit at side of Hull and Barnsley line where High Road Bridge crosses it at Everthorpe.,1842
pageContext.toSearch: Everthorpe, Brough, East Riding Of Yorkshire Hu15, UK
